text: One of the many who fell throughFirst thing I do when I open my eyes to a new day is ask myself   Why the fuck am I still here  It used to be a small and grateful prayer  Now  I can t tell what is real anymore but then again I ve never been real and no one seems to understand that  The scars on my arm only take me so far to forget and focus on the pain so that I can feel something  The pain is only temporary and I m quickly immersed back into the pool of regret and sadness  This shit is not temporary if you ve been dealing with this all of your life  These scars are not temporary  They re permanent  I m one of the many who slipped through the cracks  Deep down  I know that no one cares  But who am I to expect anything more   Psychiatrist  family  nonexistent friends  close circle  All are laughable  The voice in my head has been quiet so I guess it s better now than later  before it wake up and tries to talk me out of it   To keep it simple  this life is overwhelming and I m ready for the next one
summary: The scars on his arm only take him so far to forget and focus on the pain so that he can feel something. He is one of the many who slipped through the cracks. He knows that no one cares, but who am I to expect anything more?
cleaned: scar arm far forget focus pain feel slip crack know no care expect

summary: There is no solution to the existential anguish of knowing that one day one will die. She wishes there was an afterlife or some promise of something after death but she knows that there is nothing anyone can do about it. She doesn't understand how other people can cope with this knowledge.
